lexUnit.name: stare.v

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: look fixedly at someone or something with the eyes wide open

sentence.text: When she was alone , Sarah stood before the mirror and stared at her reflection .
As I stared across at him his white face seemed to fascinate me .
He settled by the window and stared across at the red brick Communist club beyond the budding trees .
The big man was still watching her , staring across at where she was preparing her next order .
Alyssia sat up and stared across towards the horizon .
I went down to the lakeside and stared across at that mysterious island .
Athelstan stared across at Cranston .
She opened the fridge and stared inside .
He was staring right at me .
Lachlan was standing quite still , gazing at Marion , who stared right back at him , head high , challenging him .
She stared defiantly across the cockpit table at me .
I stared grimly across the room as Lorne babbled on .
We stood staring across the icy water at the mist-shrouded island .
Inside the bedroom she stared around her in awe at the sheer scale and opulence of the room .
They stared around them in disbelief .
He stared at the ice-covered ground and half listened to the cold wind moaning gently amongst the trees .
He stared at her anxiously , then at Slater , and tried hard not to look as interested as he felt .
She stared at him incredulously .
Staring balefully from the 30-year-old 's office wall are pictures of his six predecessors .
Patrick stared from one face to the other .
Knots of Weimar citizens stood on street corners staring in curiosity .
Ruth stared in disbelief .
Mary stared in horror .
He paused for a second , staring into the fire .
The white woman stared into her wine-glass as her friend started speaking .
She stared past her father at him .
He stared slowly round the rest of the group .
Shannon rolled on to her back , staring through tear-glazed eyes at the ceiling .
Grace stared carefully through the telescope .
The bald-headed man stared placidly towards them as they approached .
He stared up the road .
` Why are you staring like a zombie ?
Well , we do see a good deal of what is around us and not simply whatever it is that we happen to be staring at .
They stared around the room .
She stared around the strange room and remembered where she was and what had happened .
Herrick was staring away again , as if bored .
Jotan turned his head , and he stared away blindly at the wall .
Philippa stared coolly back .
He did n't speak , he kept staring down .
Raising her eyes , she stared in rather horrified fascination at the opening door .
I stared on .
She went over to the window and stared out .
Evelyn was staring over his shoulder at something behind Sam 's back .
Ronni stood and stared round her , eyes wide with pleasure .
Jessica stared about in every direction , but she could see no other buildings , or sign of human life .
She sighed deeply and stared around in abject despair .
The maid who had woken her stared back without comprehension or interest .
Athelstan stared back in disbelief .
Kate stared back at him , hardly daring to believe what she 'd just heard .
He stared down at his friend .
Cornelius stared on in wonder .
I stared up at the stars .
Totally absorbed , the ringers stare straight ahead , using peripheral vision ( they call it `` rope-sight '' ) to watch the other ropes and thus time their pulls .
And the look of it - the great staring goggle eyes , and the line of white teeth like a hungry beast .
